I recently got this game after reading all the great reviews about it and played it as soon as it finished downloading. I played until I hit a checkpoint and thought that was a good idea. But then, as soon as I had to restart, it just gave me a screen that said ‚Äúwould you like to buy premium to get checkpoints?‚Äù After that it made me lose all my progress and start back at the beginning. This game is good until it becomes impossible unless you buy their stupid premium junk. This game is just another cash-grab game game looking for easy money. This could have been a five star but you guys made a two star review by making this a junk game. Would not play again, 2/10
I cannot believe that this game has terrible time for the seconds. And do I seriously need to start over each time? This is complete garbage.

Unlike what you‚Äôre set up to expect, you do not control all vehicles simultaneously, but each vehicle goes after the other under a diminishing time. Given the far reaching goals of the game (an early mistake in managing time might ruin a run, or at least make it less forgiving) it‚Äôs very fun yet fairly short, even if it takes you several days to get through it.

Surprisingly it‚Äôs fun enough to look over the unforgiving aspects of the game, such as having you start from the beginning for fully closing the app. The story itself is deep enough for you to need pen and paper to track, but it won‚Äôt stop you from playing and enjoying the game if you look over a few details.

title.label: One of the funniest games I've ever played

content.label:
Imagine a top-down driving game with a variation on Groundhog Day. You're given a destination and an open-ended neighborhood to drive through, but every subsequent character you control in a set of levels has to drive around your previous cars as you drove them. If you drove like a maniac, you'll have to navigate around that until you move to the next set of levels.

This is made much more fun from how crazy the story is, where a marriage disintegrating over an unhealthy Yorkshire Terrier obsession is probably the least outlandish thing that happens, and the cavalcade of increasingly ridiculous plots is glorious to behold.

You're on a timer until the end of the game, which even persists between level sets, and you can earn time boosts by exploring. You will need them. You can also use optional modifiers for how your car performs (each car is different), and you can eventually practice without running the clock down. You can't crash into other cars in practice mode, which has benefits and drawbacks if you forget where a car is coming from in a real run.

You can buy certain privileges to make finishing the game easier, but you don't have to. If you like this model and you also like pinball, I highly recommend PinOut by the same developers.
i never leave reviews, but this is honestly one of the best games i‚Äôve ever seen on any console. really clever, challenging, and funny!

This is an AMAZINGLY good game! It‚Äôs very clever when it comes to mechanics, and it looks great with interesting stories for each driver BUT does anyone else find it annoying to run a few courses on low time but they are short on time pickups so u run out of time easily and go all the way back to the start, now for my last statement I am also curious if people have come across a moment where because of how they drove previously they can‚Äôt get past an area I have not had this moment but I feel like I‚Äôve gotten close to that but other than that it‚Äôs an amazing game and I recommend it

The game is addictive and challenging but the time does not reset at each checkpoint, which I find annoying because it sets you ALL the way back to square one. So when i get far out, I go right back to where I start. Same with the pinball game too.

This game has very fun gameplay and everything, is probably give it 10/5 if I could. 
HOWEVER! This game does not save your checkpoints unless u pay 3 dollars. So, if u get to a high level and have to leave (ugh, lifeüòí) you will have to start back at the BEGINNING next time. I get that the developers need to get money, but being able to save it should be a liberty for all players to have. Maybe there could be a mode that has turbo, traction control, and sheild All on one car that we have to pay 4. This review will stay low until this major flaw is fixed. However, the game itself is great! (But not when u always restart.)
